Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui.scenes

Class ChoicesPanel

java.lang.Object
fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui.scenes.GridBagCell
fr.sos.witchhunt.view.gui.scenes.ChoicesPanel
Direct Known Subclasses:
GamePanel.ActionsPanel
public class ChoicesPanel extends GridBagCell

This class defines a visual representation for Menus on the GUI View.

Is an extension of JPanel adapted to fit into a scene that is an extension of GridBagPanel. (see GridBagCell)

Used by the ingame scene, in order to represent a Menu letting the user choose an action to perform in the match among plural possibilities.

Used by the main menu scene in order to navigate into the application as well.

*

Displays the Menu's entitled as a JLabel placed at the top of the cell.

Also displays each Menu entry , which is represented by a corresponding ChoiceButton.

Collects user-input from the graphical interface using a single instance of ChoicesPanelController.

See Also:

    • controller

      private ChoicesPanelController controller

      The instance of ChoicesPanelController in charge of collecting user-input.

      Listens for ActionEvents on each active ChoiceButton.

      Set when calling makeChoice(InputMediator) and destroyed when calling choiceHasBeenMade().

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      This method is called when the master GridBagPanel's init method is called.

      Used to configure the cells depending on their real size once they are rendered.

      Override if a special configuration is needed only after rendering the Grid.

      Set alignment of contained Components to CENTER_ALIGNMENT. Adds a margin before and after the prompt.
      Overrides:
      init in class GridBagCell
      See Also:
      • GridBagPanel.init()

      Parameters:

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu(Menu m)

      Represents any Menu given in parameter into the cell.

      - Displays the Menu's entitled using a JLabel placed at the top of the cell.

      - Makes a ChoiceButton out of each entry of this Menu that is not console-only (special char sequence "/c/") and adds it to the list of ChoiceButtons to render. The buttons' text and style are set using static methods of the ChoiceButton class, determining how to represent a choice depending on its type.

      - Renders the result

      Parameters:
      m - The Menu to be represented into the cell
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • The Menu's entitled is displayed using a JLabel placed at the top of the cell
      • ChoiceButton
      • ChoiceButton.makeButtonText(Object)
      • ChoiceButton.getButtonColorByActionType(Object)
      • ChoiceButton.setTheme(java.awt.Color)
      • renderPane()

    • displayCards

      public void displayCards(Menu m, boolean forceReveal)

      Represents a Menu containing only entries of type RumourCard into the cell.

      - Displays the Menu's entitled using a JLabel placed at the top of the cell.

      - Makes a ChoiceButton out of each Rumour card contained in this Menu's array of options.

      - Renders the result

      isChoosingACard() will be set to true.

      Parameters:
      m - The Menu to be represented into the cell
      See Also:
      • Menu
      • The Menu's entitled is displayed using a JLabel placed at the top of the cell
      • ChoiceButton
      • ChoiceButton.makeCardButtonText(RumourCard, boolean)
      • displayMenu(Menu)

    • setThemeAsForActionType

      See Also:

    • makeChoice

      public void makeChoice(InputMediator im)
      Instantiates a ChoicesPanelController to gather user-input within the Menu entries represented by this cell.
      Parameters:
      im - The InputMediator sending the input request and waiting for the user's choice.
      See Also:
      • ChoicesPanelController
      • InputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)

    • renderActionButtons

      public void renderActionButtons()

      Adds each ChoiceButton of the list of ChoiceButtons to render to the cell's content pane, under the prompt.

      The width of the ChoiceButtons is normalized artificially to match that of the longest one by modifying each button's internal margins.

      Adds a vertical margin (Box::createRigidArea(Dimension)) between the buttons.

      See Also:
      • ChoiceButton
      • ChoiceButton.setInsets(Insets)
      • RigidAreas are used as vertical margins disposed between the ChoiceButtons.

    • resetPane

      public void resetPane()

      Cleans the cell's content.

      - The prompt is set to an empty String.

      - Each of the {choiceButtonsList rendered ChoiceButtons} is removed.

      - Each of the inter-button margins is removed.

      - If there is a controller waiting to receive input from within this cell's ChoiceButtons, abandons them.

    • renderPane

      public void renderPane()
      See Also:
      • renderActionButtons()

    • isRendered

      public boolean isRendered()

    • isChoosingACard

      public boolean isChoosingACard()
      Returns:
      true if the cell is currently used for choosing a Rumour card, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Used by the ingame scene to display a chosen card differently on the other cells

    • choiceHasBeenMade

      public void choiceHasBeenMade()

      Called by the InputMediator collecting input from the current scene to notify the ChoicesPanel that a user has made their choice, from this view or from another. and that the controller should be destroyed immediately.

      See Also:
      • ConcreteInputMediator
      • ConcreteInputMediator::makeChoice(Menu)
      • GamePanel::choiceHasBeenMade(Object)
      • ChoicesPanelController::destroyMouseListeners()
